conclusion: Determine how shadows change when the light source moves backwards.
Shadows will move forward as the light source moves backwards.
Shadows will become larger as the light source moves backwards.
Shadow A is cast by the birdcage.
Shadow A will move forward and become larger as the light source moves backwards.
Shadow B is cast by the red box.
Shadow B will move forward and become larger as the light source moves backwards.
Shadow C is cast by the black lampshade.
Shadow C will move forward and become larger as the light source moves backwards.
Shadow D is cast by the ornate object.
Shadow D will move forward and become larger as the light source moves backwards.
Final answer: All shadows will move forward and become larger when the light source moves backwards.
